oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Record Breaking Blood Bank Observes First Anniversary
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Newspaper article titled, "Record Breaking Blood Bank Observes First Anniversary," including two photographs taken by Jack Gunter. The bottom image shows Miss Margaret Croft in a Red Cross uniform with Governor Browning (1889-1976) at the Red Cross Blood Center in Nashville for the Regional Blood Program. Browning, who was the Nashville Regional Blood Program's number one donor in 1949, is seen signing a card to become the first donor of the program's second year.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Blood banks; Blood donors; Women volunteers; American Red Cross; Volunteer workers in medical care;
Governors; Government officials; Uniforms; Nurses
